properties.areaDesc: Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake; Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area; Northern Washoe County
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 8 at 7:08PM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
Breezy northerly winds have kicked up quite a bit of dust off the
Smoke Creek and Black Rock Deserts this afternoon and evening.
Dust is settling into downwind valleys bringing localized areas
with visibility reduced below 4 miles, including portions of the
Greater Reno-Carson City area. Be aware of the potential for
rapid changes in visibility while driving tonight.

The dust is also causing reductions in air quality and the
current Air Quality Index as of 7 pm PST is indicating Unhealthy
for Sensitive Groups. If you have air quality concerns, please
contact your local Air Quality Management Division, or find the
latest information on airnow.gov.

Winds are expected to remain elevated overnight, becoming stronger
again Sunday. Additional areas of blowing dust are likely into
Sunday.
